channel.title: R on Padgett: Beyond-STAT
channel.description: Recent content in R on Padgett: Beyond-STAT

item.title: Introduction to R and Simulating Data
item.description: Before we get started with an introduction to simulation, we need to make sure that R and R Studio are downloaded on your computers. R is an open source and free statistical programming language. R utilizes user built ‘packages.’ The package library is huge and you can find a package that does nearly anything you need it to and a large number of these are regularly updated. We will talk about packages a lot over the never few years so this is kind of tertiary.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
